comment: A little more oak and char than your normal rye. They do a double barrel process. At around 2 years, still tastes a little young but not too bad. Would probably mostly have it as a mixer for now. I will be interested to see how it turns out after a little more aging. Price is high. But that's mostly due to AL's stupidly insane liquor prices.

From memory. This reminded me of Evil Evan. Both whiskeys from black patch have very heavy charring, with some water it gets a tad better, but the charred oak taste dominated the bottle. It honestly didn't taste much like rye. I gave it away, and I don't recommend it at that price range.
